alert.note: Alert for Iowa; Johnson (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 11:49AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Johnson, southeastern Benton, southern Linn and northeastern Iowa Counties through 1230 PM CDT... At 1147 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Robins to near Oxford. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rainfall with rates up to 1 inch per hour possible. Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor flooding is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Hiawatha and Robins around 1150 AM CDT. Marion around 1155 AM CDT. Bertram around 1200 PM CDT. Swisher around 1205 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include North Liberty, Springville, Shueyville, Lake Macbride State Park and Solon. This includes Interstate 380 between mile markers 4 and 27. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
